channel.title: Comments on: My ‘High Standards’ for Software Development
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: chopstik
item.dc:creator: chopstik
item.description: I think you may be missing a larger point as far as the business is concerned, however. The issue of standards only become an issue to the business when the cost of doing the "upgrades" to create those standards become less than the cost of maintaining lousy applications that require high levels of support. Sadly, in my experience, this is rarely the case.

item.title: By: LNBruno
item.dc:creator: LNBruno
item.content:encoded:
I’ve often wondered if any company anywhere has ever given consideration to whether FIXING their software would be cheaper than providing 24 x 7 customer “support.”

A certain ERP software system for small to mid-size manufacturers springs to mind….
